OperationDefinition_en: YYY characters (from 000 to 999) replace specified Table B data width
YYY (from -99 to 999) replaces the specified Table B scale factor
YYY characters (from 001 to 999), including spaces, are inserted as a data field

Change unit to unit defined in Common Code table C-6 by code figure equal to YYY, for example:   YYY = 040 changes unit to Celsius   YYY = 741 changes unit to km h-1   YYY = 201 changes unit to knot   YYY = 740 changes unit to km
YYY national letters including spaces are inserted as a data field.
YYY characters (from 000 to 999) replace specified Table B data width
YYY (from -99 to 999) replaces the specified Table B scale factor
YYY characters (from 001 to 999), including spaces, are inserted as a data field

Change unit to unit defined in Common Code Table C-6 by code figure equal to YYY, for example:   YYY = 040 changes unit to Celsius   YYY = 741 changes unit to km h-1   YYY = 201 changes unit to knot   YYY = 740 changes unit to km
This operator denotes the beginning of the definition of an event.
This operator denotes the conclusion of the event definition that was begun via the previous C-41-000 operator.
This operator denotes the beginning of the definition of a conditioning event
This operator denotes the conclusion of the conditioning event definition that was begun via the previous C-42-000 operator.
The values which follow are categorical forecast values.
This operator denotes the conclusion of the definition of categorical forecast values that was begun via the previous C-43-000 operator.
YYY national letters including spaces are inserted as a data field.
